data.title: Sonerai Community
data.meta_description: im new too the sonerai i just recently bought a sonerai llL with a aerovee 2180 motor and need info about what size prop would be best and any other helpful info on the plane as i dont know much
data.text:
Post by shanenothdurft on

im new too the sonerai i just recently bought a sonerai llL with a aerovee 2180 motor and need info about what size prop would be best and any other helpful info on the plane as i dont know much except its fast

Post by soneraifred on

Most of us with 2180's on Sonerai II's use a prop that is between 52" and 54" in diameter, and between 46" and 50" of pitch. On my IIL I have a Sterba 52 x 46. A lot of guys run 52x48. What are you looking for?

Post by daddo2 on

I have a S-II with an Aerovee 2180. Using a Sterba 54X46 that seems to work well. My buddy has a KR2 with a Revmaster 2.1, same prop.

Post by shanenothdurft on

thanks for the info on the prop size i talked with ed sterba and he told me the same my prop looks old and unsafe im looking for the best prop for my aerovee 2180 also does anyone know anything about the aerovee injector carb my engine also has this carb and im just needing some info

Post by shanenothdurft on

my 2180 has a 2 inch wooden prop extension does anyone know where i can get a aluminum one or some kind of fix for this situation the prop has to be extended because of the cowling

Post by hans on

These have SAE-1 bolt patterns, which might not be suitable for a retrofit without also replacing the flange.

Post by smoothmat on

When i got mine hub spacer made i just went down to local machine shop and got them to spin one up. I took them the crush plate for a template and told them how thick i need the spacer. Once they had the hub made with the bolt pattern i got them to drill 1" hole in between the bolt pattern to lighten it up a bit. Works good and only cost 200.00

I have a picture of it before i installed it, although i am not sure how to post it on here.

Post by hans on

does anyone know if revmaster and the aerovee have the same bolt patteren

see revmasterautomotive.com/revmasteraviation/?p=308

and www.aeroconversions.com/products/aerovee/index.html

it's all there...
